thread.title: Table toppers: Cambridge team takes on the best of Europe
thread.title_full: Table toppers: Cambridge team takes on the best of Europe | Anglia - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Table toppers: Cambridge team takes on the best of Europe

organizations.name: itv news anglia's stuart leithes play

text:
Like many of the top British football teams Cambridge Table Football Club has a couple of talented foreigners in their line-up.
After finishing second in the national league they've qualified for the European Championships.
Click below to watch a report by ITV News Anglia's Stuart Leithes
Play video "I'm pretty apprehensive if I'm honest, we might be in trouble some of the teams there are pretty good.
"It definitely steps up a league from what we've been playing in England. The standard here's good but there they draw in players from a much bigger player base."
– James Littlefair, Club Founder The team in action One of the masters of the fixed 3-5-2-1 formation is Vesti Gerova.
She's one of two Bulgarian players in the Cambridge team - and last year she was ranked 2nd in the world for women's singles.
"Kids really enjoy foosball, but it's very much like a real sport with all the rules and referees.
"People imagine it's just for fun but when you get to the big tournaments it's very serious."
– Vesti Gerova One of Cambridge's in form players! Yordan Zaykov is also from Bulgaria. In mainland Europe it's a sport that they take very seriously.
"We'll try, I don't think we'll win.
"It's extremely competitive there are different teams from many different countries and they play on many different tables so they have expertise in many different tables I think that makes it a little difficult because we don't have a lot of experience on all the tables.
"I don't think we'll win but we'll have a lot of fun."
– Yordan Zaykov Last updated Tue 21 Feb 2017 And Finally Cambridgeshire Cambridge
